title: Emmerdale's Michelle Hardwick reveals she and wife Kate Brooks invited a handyman to their wedding
text:
She tied the knot to soap producer Kate Brooks at Graceland in Memphis last month following a one-year romance.

And Emmerdale's Michelle Hardwick lifted the lid on their intimate Elvis Presley-inspired wedding as she appeared on Tuesday's edition of This Morning.

The actress, 43, revealed they randomly invited a hotel maintenance man to the nuptials after meeting at a hotel in Tennessee, admitting the worker and his mother were two out of four guests to witness the couple exchange their vows.

Newlywed bliss: Michelle Hardwick lifted the lid on their intimate Elvis Presley-inspired wedding as she appeared on Tuesday's edition of This Morning

Soap star Michelle beamed with delight as she recalled the recent ceremony, which took place near Graceland, once owned by late legendary singer Elvis.

On their inspiration behind travelling to the landmark, the Wakefield native shared: 'Yeah, we got married 10th September, she’s one of the bosses! We got married in Graceland, Memphis, I love Elvis, my dad loves Elvis, Kate loves Elvis.

'She’s been to Graceland before, I’ve never been, we thought we’d get married somewhere different, we love America.'

Confessing the pair had to keep the country's past attitudes towards same-sex marriages in mind, Michelle added: 'We had to think, "Nah, we won’t do Vegas, let’s see if we are allowed to get married in Memphis?”

They do! The actress, 43, tied the knot to soap producer Kate Brooks at Graceland in Memphis last month following a one-year romance

'We never thought he'd turn up in a million years': The TV star revealed they randomly invited a hotel maintenance man to the nuptials after meeting at a hotel in Tennessee

Throwback: The Emmerdale star shared a snap after exchanging vows at the The King's famous Southern home (Elvis right in 1957)

Jaw-dropping: The sprawling property has been turned into a museum full of memorabilia from The King's lifetime. He died in 1977

'We had to phone to check, because we are a same-sex couple, are we even allowed to get married? [But] it was incredible, a chapel in the woods, just behind Elvis’ house, his back garden!'

The media personality went on to discuss how the hotel's handyman managed to bag an invite to their private wedding.

She told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: 'We turned up at the hotel in Memphis, trying to look for our room and a guy who works there, John the maintenance guy, said: “Girls, how can I help you?”

'He showed us to our suite, and we said we’re getting married on Tuesday. When he asked "where abouts?" and we said, "Graceland".'

Big fan: On their inspiration behind travelling to the landmark, the Wakefield native shared: 'I love Elvis, my dad loves Elvis, Kate loves Elvis!'

Private ceremony: The blonde revealed the hotel worker and his mother were two out of four guests to witness the couple exchange their vows

Michelle admitted the pair invited the worker to their wedding as a friendly gesture as they thought he'd 'never gonna turn up in a million years', but were left shocked when he arrived to the event with his mother.

The blonde added: 'He said Tuesday is his day off, and that he'd love to come watch. We had just come up as a two, not a soul with us to get married, but because we are so nice, we thought yeah.

'Kate and I got a lovely Cadillac took us to Graceland. When we got there, our wedding planner said: "Oh girls, lovely to meet you, you look beautiful, two of your friends are here".

'We thought "who? Is it people from work?", but we later realised it was John and his mother.

Warm reception: Revealing the staff member was overwhelmed with emotion, she shared: 'He sat there and sobbed all the way through the vows'

Smitten: Michelle - who was previously married to music teacher Rosie Nicholl - first announced her engagement to Kate in December last year

Revealing he was overwhelmed with emotion, she said: 'He sat there and sobbed all the way through the vows. His mother was talking all the way through… they rocked up in jeans, trainers and leggings.

'They weren’t even witnesses, the photographer and Erin our wedding coordinator were.'

Michelle - who was previously married to music teacher Rosie Nicholl - first announced her engagement to Kate in December last year.

Their wedding comes just weeks after actress Michelle admitted she still encounters the threat of homophobia when out and about with now wife.

Michelle - who plays Vanessa Woodfield in the ITV soap - revealed she 'lives in fear ever day' and believes society is 'going backwards'.

She told The Mirror: 'Sometimes if Kate and I see a group of young lads we instinctively let go of each other’s hands because we’re scared they’ll turn on us. We live with that fear every day.

'I feel like we’re going backwards in society with our attitudes. People who say, “Gay Pride? Why isn’t there a Straight Pride?” I’ll tell you why, because you don’t need it.

‘Because luckily for you, you’re able to be affectionate with your partner in public and you won’t be abused for it. It’s absolutely vile what goes on.'
